steps.text: Put 100g plain flour, 2 large eggs, 300ml milk, 1 tbsp sunflower or vegetable oil and a pinch of salt into a bowl
Set aside for 30 mins to rest if you have time, or start cooking straight away.
Set a medium frying pan or crêpe pan over a medium heat and carefully wipe it with some oiled kitchen paper.
When hot, cook your pancakes for 1 min on each side until golden, keeping them warm in a low oven as you go.
Serve with lemon wedges and caster sugar, or your favourite filling. Once cold, you can layer the pancakes between baking
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Mix with a wooden spoon.
After 12 to 20 hours, your dough will smell like beer and appear bubbly. Using wet hands, place dough on a lightly floured surface.
Half an hour before the second rise is finished, get ready by setting your oven to 450 degrees and putting your empty covered pot inside to heat up.
When hot, cook your pancakes for 1 min on each side until golden, keeping them warm in a low oven as you go.
Remove hot pot from the oven. Depending on the material of your pot, you may need to grease it with butter.
Start by simply sautéing your onion it a bit of olive oil.
Add chicken, vegetables and broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes then add noodles and cook according to their package directions or until al dente.
